newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Kuoni won't rule out higher 1997 dividend.
newsitem.headline: Kuoni won't rule out higher 1997 dividend.

text.p: Kuoni Reisen Holding AG said it was possible that its dividend on 1997 results could be increased from the 1996 level if earnings develop as expected.
Asked at the company's annual news conference about prospects for the dividend, Chairman Daniel Affolter said: "If the concern's earnings increase, the dividend can also increase."
Given expectations of higher earnings this year, "that would mean that the dividend could be increased," he said.
Kuoni has proposed a dividend on 1996 results of 14 Swiss franc per A registered share and 70 francs per B registered share. That compares with nine francs and 45 francs respectively on 1995 results.

Affolter said in a presentation that Kuoni was paying out 22.4 million francs in dividends on 1996 earnings, or 32 percent of group profit. "We thus reached our goal of a payout ratio of between 30 and 35 percent," he said.
Kuoni said earlier it expected double-digit revenue and earnings growth in 1997 if exchange rates remain steady.
